page.title: 08CRAIGTON-THEN AND NOW
page.content: Mr. Alistair Forbes told us of Craigton 60 years ago when he was a boy. He told us that then there were no taxis or buses to take the children to school so each person had to walk.The school outside looked much the same but inside the desks were arranged in tiers and had lids which lifted up.Inside you kept your books. The road was untarred and covered in whinstone from the local quarry (the old Craigangawn Quarry, now disused).In winter when the nights were cold and the lamps were lit, Mr Forbes and his family had to amuse themselves.Sometimes they would skate on Craigton Loch which is no longer there.The farmers would take lamps there in the evenings so that they could curl.Frequently in the evenings people got together at someone's house or the school for social evenings.
